rComments: Schumm was excellent. He was extremely involved in the class and was very helpful in answering questions. Also in hearing from others who took 133 with different professors Schumm was present and actively around much more than most others.

Bruce is such a kind hearted man. He genuinely cares about improving the course for students. The test I admit are hard but it's physics... It's always gonna be hard. Much better than Kuttner, OMG that man is terrible. I wish he would teach 6c. Not looking to taking it with Kuttner this summer.

Professor Schumm is great. He is very clear in lecture and makes physics more interesting than expected. Overall he is a very good teacher. However, this man writes HORRIBLE tests. They are extremely hard & I felt that even if I had studied the material back & forth, the tests were still un-doable. He NEEDS to make his tests MORE DOABLE!!!!!!!!!!!!

Bruce Schumm is the best physics teacher I've ever had! I'm no physics person, but Bruce is such a good teacher that I was able to do well just by going to class and doing the homework: no consistent office hour haunting, no staying up late studying. he talks and it makes sense. amazing!
This guy rocks, funny, lectures pertain to the material, and he explains things well. His tests are fair, he covers both the math of physics and the concepts.

Prof. Schumm's dry, sarcastic humor makes the class the amazingness that it is.  Not only was he entertaining but his lectures really helped me understand the material. Don't be afraid to talk with him either, he doesn't have the "holier-than-thou" aura that a lot of profs do.

Bruce Schumm is pretty much the coolest professor ever! His lectures are clear and fun, and his homework is very helpful. Bruce's tests are very difficult, but if you're studying modern physics and you expect easy tests, you're crazy. On the last day of 101B, we took him out and got him ****.

This class is extremely hard, but well worth it. Bruce is extremely helpful and dedicated as a professor, and he tries to make himself available for outside help. It was a battle, but I'm very glad that I stuck with it because I learned a hell of a lot.

Bruce is extremely intelligent, but he doesn't fall prey to the folly of being over the students' heads.  If he mentioned something that would be beyond us (as the class is for non-majors) he would add, "But you guys don't need to know that."  The tests were fair, and easier than the homework (which was hard). Plus I liked his dark sense of humour.
